articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves Dar-Es-Salaam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Dar-Es-Salaam
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left Dar-Es-Salaam on Sunday after wrapping up his official goodwill visit to Tanzania.
					
					 He was accompanied by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and other suite members. 
					
					 Kim and his party were seen off by Minister of Constitution and Justice of Tanzania Celina Kombani and DPRK Ambassador to Tanzania Jo Yong Man.

articles.title: Exhibition of Scientific Research Findings Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Scientific Research Findings Held 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of scientific research findings by academic degree holders took place at the Grand People's Study House.
					
					 On display were more than 430 new scientific and technological data, over 400 products and at least 560 kinds of books. It was held divided into sections of social science, natural science, agricultural science and medical science.
					
					Kim Il Sung University, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, the Academy of Social Sciences and other units put on display books comprehensively dealing with original ideologies and theories, leadership, noble traits and immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Drawing the attention of participants were books in the fields of political theory, historical science, literature and art, sports, etc.
					
					 Appreciated at the exhibition were findings by research institutes under the State Academy of Sciences, Kim Chaek University of Technology, University of Science and a lot of other units.
					
					 The Academy of Agricultural Science, Wonsan University of Agriculture, etc. presented valuable research findings which solved scientific and technological issues arising in breeding superior breeds suited to the climate of Korea and promoting agricultural production, stock farming, fruit farming and agricultural administration.
					
					 Those academic degree holders in the field of medical science presented highly-efficacious medicines, medical treatments, medical apparatuses, etc.

articles.title: DPRK Proves Successful in International Tournaments
articles.content:
DPRK Proves Successful in International Tournaments 

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK sportspersons have scored good results in international tournaments this year. 
					
					 Ro Un Ok and Kim Kum Ok, DPRK girls,  took the first place in the IAAF-24th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon held in Pyongyang in April and the marathon of the 5th World Military Games respectively.
					
					 The DPRK boys were qualified for the 2012 Asian U-16 and U-19 football championships and girls for the 2012 Olympic Games and for the 2012 U-20 Women's World Cup.
					
					 The country bagged 4 trophies, 19 gold medals, 3 silver medals and 3 bronze medals to finish first in the team standings in the 17th ITF World Taekwon-Do Championship, which took place in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Un Guk won a gold medal in the 2011 World Weightlifting Championship and Yun Won Chol and Kim Ran Mi gained good results in the 2011 World Wrestling Championship to win tickets for the 2012 Olympic Games. 
					
					 Yang Kyong Il and Yang Chun Song placed first in the men's freestyle event of the 2011 Asian Wrestling Championship. 
					
					 DPRK girls won the 25m sports pistol and 25m rapid-fire pistol team events of the 5th World Military Games.
					
					The DPRK also proved successful in the 2011 Asian Cup Women's Boxing 
					
					 Tournament, international invitation track-and-field tournament held in Taipei of China, 2011 International Aero Model Contest for Mongolia Cup, 26th World Universiad and 25th Pyongyang International Invitational Table Tennis Tournament.

articles.title: Metal Industry Undergoes Technological Updating in Korea
articles.content:
Metal Industry Undergoes Technological Updating in Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK has registered great achievements this year in technological updating of the metal industry.
					
					 The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex finished the building of a heating furnace based on high-temperature air combustion and started operating a new rolled iron plate production system.
					
					 The newly-built furnace, with a long serviceable life, doubles the former in thermal efficiency, while reducing the oxidation rate of blooms.
					
					 The Songjin Steel Complex newly built an oxygen melting furnace and a shaft pellet oxidizing roasting furnace and reconstructed or updated production processes to boost steel output.
					
					 The Posan Steel Works of the Chollima Steel Complex, Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and Chongjin Steel Plant have increased production with locally available raw materials and fuel.
					
					 Meanwhile, scientists applied a new technology of producing self-baking electrode, which makes it possible to produce self-baking electrodes with no cokes and graphite but anthracite.
					
					 The technology marked another great turn in the development of the metallurgical industry.

articles.title: Changgwang Health Complex Enjoys Popularity for Hairdressing Service
articles.content:
Changgwang Health Complex Enjoys Popularity for Hairdressing Service
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Changgwang Health Complex on the banks of the River Pothong in Pyongyang draws many people for haircut and beauty treatment.
					
					 The barbershop and beauty salon in the complex display scores of hairstyles. 
					
					 An Su Gil, honored with the title of Merited Barber, told KCNA short-cut, medium-cut and square-cut hairstyles are now popular among young men.
					
					 Kim Mun Hyok, a 30-year-old man living in Sadong District, said, "I frequent the Changgwang Health Complex to have my hair cut square."
					
					 After receiving beauty treatment, Kim Yong Bok, a 36-year-old woman, said, "The Changgwang Health Complex is very popular for beauty treatment. I often come here for hairdressing."
					
					 Kim Yong Sun, a winner of the title of Merited Beauty Artist, said:
					
					 "We serve customers with different hairstyles suitable for them. I feel proud of seeing many women coming to our beauty salon."

articles.title: Kangwon Province Take Lead in Producing Organic Fertilizers
articles.content:
Kangwon Province Take Lead in Producing Organic Fertilizers 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Co-op farms in Kangwon Province in the eastern part of Korea are directing big efforts to making organic fertilizers.
					
					 The economically efficient fertilizers include aminoacid-micronutrient compound fertilizer and compost fertilizer.
					
					 The fertilizers help crops fully absorb nitrogen and kalium, facilitate their growth and raise the efficiency of chemical fertilizers.
					
					 They also raise the humus level of soil and prevent soil's oxidation.
					
					About 1,000 compost fertilizer producers have been built throughout the province this year alone.
					
					 The Pisan Co-op Farm in Anbyon County succeeded in making the compound fertilizer in an industrial way and popularized the method throughout the country.
					
					 Munchon City and Kosan County are taking the lead in making those kinds of fertilizers.

articles.title: Geographical Book Attached to True Records of King Sejong
articles.content:
Geographical Book Attached to True Records of King Sejong 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Geographical Book Attached to True Records of King Sejong is one of the Korean nation's precious cultural heritages, which is conducive to studying the history and geography of Korea before the second half of the 15th century.
					
					 The book began to be compiled from the end of the year 1424 and became a part of Sejong Silok (chronicles of King Sejong) in 1454.
					
					 The book is a revised and supplemented edition of the previously compiled Geographical Book on Eight Provinces.
					
					The book divides the country into 8 provinces and gives their geographical details.
					
					 The details include administrative changes of counties and sub-counties, their history, numbers of their households, military deployments and names of provincial seats.
					
					 It is made up of more than 60 particulars geographically dealing with politics, economy, military, culture and nature.

articles.title: Palhae, One of Kingdoms in Korean History
articles.content:
Palhae, One of Kingdoms in Korean History 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Palhae (698-926), the successor to Koguryo, is well known in the Korean history for its strong military and developed economy and culture in the middle ages.
					
					 The kingdom was governed by emperor called Hwangsang or Chonson, which means a descendent of Heaven.
					
					Palhae, pursuing an invariable foreign policy, established relations with neighboring nations on its own initiative and defended its territorial integrity from invasions. 
					
					 The kingdom was capable of mobilizing 400,000 military personnel already in its early years and had hundreds of thousands of troops on a regular basis in the whole period of its existence. It retook most of the Koguryo territory by dint of military muscle. 
					
					 Rice, fermented soybean, plum, pear, silk, iron, copper and cotton cloth produced in the kingdom were in great demand at home and abroad.
					
					 For some two hundred years the kingdom was called a thriving nation in the East.
					
					 The excellent tradition and history of Palhae were carried forward by Koryo, the first unified state of the Korean nation.

articles.title: DPRK Opposes All Forms of Sanctions and Pressure: KCNA
articles.content:
DPRK Opposes All Forms of Sanctions and Pressure: KCNA

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and West are toughening their moves to check Iran's nuclear program for peaceful purposes before and after the meeting of the Board of Governors of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).
					
					 Just after the IAEA made public a report, U.S. President Obama called for exploring every possible means to ratchet up pressure on Iran, openly revealing the U.S. stand not to rule out a military option.
					
					 The West including the U.S. has become unprecedented in tightening sanctions against Iran over oil, gas and bank fields.
					
					 With nothing can the U.S. justify this as it is a wanton violation of the sovereignty and dignity of a sovereign country.
					
					 In response to the West moves, Iran has taken tougher policy, asserting it would not rule out military showdown.
					
					 Its president clarified the stand not to make any concession in its right to peaceful nuclear development, stressing it will not establish any relations with the U.S. in the future, either.
					
					 The Iranian military announced that if aggressors make an attack on Iran's nuclear facilities, they will be made to pay a dear price.
					
					 The speaker of the Iranian Majlis said that the West unreasonable sanctions will not impact the Iranian people's will to step up nuclear program.
					
					 The bloated Iran's nuclear issue and tensions running high in the region are attributable to the U.S. improper moves to hold in check the peaceful nuclear activities of those countries incurring its displeasure.
					
					 Iran has been subject to sanctions by the U.S. and the West for scores of years after it set up an anti-imperialist independent government. The IAEA's report on Iran's nuclear issue was made public in November to upgrade sanctions on Iran.
					
					 The report has assumed political nature due to the deliberate moves of the U.S. and its followers and information has been revised to make Iran's nuclear issue appear to have military dimensions.
					
					 It is quite natural that the report was dismissed and rejected by the international community as a "brainchild" of the U.S. and West and an absurd trick and fabrication full of falsity and deception as soon as it was released.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. and West are pushing the Mideast situation to the worst phase, persistently taking issue with Iran's nuclear program. Clear is their aim.
					
					 It is their real intention to strike Iran's economic mainstay in a bid to stifle it and overturn the present Islamic system.
					
					 Their sanctions and pressure on Iran are by no means aimed at nuclear non-proliferation.
					
					 Iran's acute nuclear issue and touch-and-go situation created in the Mideast are due to the U.S. and the Western forces following it.
					
					 This clearly proves that the U.S. is the chieftain which deliberately gave rise to Iran's nuclear issue and coiled up the tension in the Mideast.
					
					 The U.S. sanctions on Iran would only strain regional and overall international situation and bring catastrophic consequences to global economy.
					
					 All forms of sanctions and pressure on Iran including military option should be renounced with immediate effect.
					
					 Iran's nuclear issue should be settled through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The DPRK opposes and rejects the U.S. and West attempt to abuse peaceful nuclear issue as a means for overthrowing the system of a sovereign state.

articles.title: Japan Should Not Interrupt DPRK's Peaceful Nuclear Activities: KCNA
articles.content:
Japan Should Not Interrupt DPRK's Peaceful Nuclear Activities:KCNA

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries lobbied for the adoption of a resolution voicing "concerns" over the DPRK's uranium enrichment and construction of a light water reactor at the recent plenary session of the UN General Assembly.
					
					 The DPRK can never tolerate Japan's moves as they are part of anti-DPRK maneuvers intended to violate the legitimate rights of a sovereign state.
					
					 Japan, counting on the United States, has lobbied other countries in a mischievous manner in the international arena, claiming it is the "opinion of international community".
					
					 However, it has brought nothing new and instead disclosed its true colors as a nuclear servant of the U.S.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the DPRK's right to peaceful use of nuclear energy is a matter of vital importance pertaining to its sovereignty and the right to development.
					
					 The DPRK's uranium enrichment and construction of a light water reactor are not matter of any "concerns" as they are exercise of the legitimate right to the peaceful use of nuclear energy.
					
					 The DPRK decided to build a light water reactor with its own efforts in line with the state economic development strategy in the face of the dead-end project of the reactor which was originally set to be offered from outside.
					
					 The DPRK has opened to public at home and abroad every phase of its activities for developing nuclear energy.
					
					 As part of its activities, the DPRK has pushed ahead with the construction of a trial light water reactor and the production of low- enriched uranium for fueling it.
					
					 Several other countries have buckled down to the development and use of nuclear energy for peaceful purposes.
					
					 Nuclear power plants built by member states of ASEAN numbered more than 430 at present.
					
					 Additional 190 to 350 nuclear power plants are expected to come online in 20 years to come, according to a data available from ASEAN.
					
					 It is preposterous for Japan to take issue with the nuclear activities of the DPRK defying the trend of the present times.
					
					 Japan has no moral qualifications to find fault with the peaceful nuclear activities of the DPRK.
					
					 It is as mum as a mouse when it comes to the U.S. plan to invest 700 billion dollars in modernization of nuclear weapons in the upcoming 10 years. This shows that it has not yet departed from its shameless policy of submitting to the U.S.
					
					 Japan, under the U.S. "nuclear umbrella", sparked serious concerns of the world for the massive radioactive leakage following the explosion of a nuclear power plant.
					
					 This has claimed huge toll in countries neighboring Japan.
					
					 Japan has so far advocated "three non-nuclear principles".
					
					 However, it had stroke a secret pact with the U.S. on allowing nuclear-capable U.S. warships to call at or pass through its territorial waters, thus increasing nuclear threat to Northeast Asia.
					
					 Not content with turning the Japan's archipelago into an advance nuclear base of the U.S., Japan has persistently pressed ahead with the independent moves to go nuclear.
					
					 Japan tries to find fault with the DPRK's peaceful nuclear activities for fear that its nuclear moves would touch off public criticism.
					
					 Japan has always hobbled the efforts to settle the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It is shameless for it to cozy up to the American master by taking issue with the DPRK's legitimate rights and making a fuss in the international arena.
					
					 As a state that has shaped internal and external policies reading the U.S.
					
					face, Japan can not get rid of its status as a political maid and faithful servant of the U.S.  The politicians of Japan had better behave gently, aware that interference in its neighbors' state strategic issues will damage the national interests.

articles.title: Any Threat and Blackmail Will Not Work on DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Any Threat and Blackmail Will Not Work on DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. should draw due lesson from its bankrupt hostile policy towards the DPRK for this year and take a right choice.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 This year the U.S. made persistent and vicious efforts to isolate and stifle the DPRK as never before, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Violence, terror, psychological warfare and the like are main methods of aggression employed by the U.S. imperialists at present. The U.S. imperialists would put the strong-arm policy to the fore or use the methods of terror and psychological warfare before anything else in keeping with situation and object and, if necessary, combine such ploys. Anyhow, what they have attached special importance is the way of threat and blackmail. But such way could never work on the DPRK.
					
					 The conclusion the Korean people came to this year again is that they should heighten the vigilance against the cunning double-dealing tactics of the U.S. to the maximum and resolutely take tougher attitude toward the tough policy of the U.S. warmongers.
					
					 The DPRK will always emerge victorious in the battle to defend socialism as it has the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, the people with firm will and faith that they are sure to win in the fight with the enemy and the invincible army fully prepared in politico-ideological and military technical aspects.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Put Media under Control Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Put Media under Control Flayed
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Four ultra-right conservative newspapers of south Korea started the wired TV broadcasting services from Dec. 1, being granted preferential treatment. This is seen as part of the moves pushed forward by the authorities to let conservative media monopolize broadcasting field. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The rash act on the part of the south Korean authorities is the product of their sinister attempt to strangle the progressive media and mislead the public opinion through the ultra-right conservative media and thus put down the people's protests and tide over the serious ruling crisis.
					
					 Putting media under control to stamp out progressive media is a major means employed by the south Korean conservative group to stay in power as it regards the fascist dictatorship as the mode of its existence.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' offer of wired TV broadcasting right to the most reactionary newspapers is a fascist media coup to put media under control.
					
					 70 percent of south Korea's media market is held by the field of broadcasting. Herein lies the reason why the present south Korean ruling forces have worked hard to put broadcasting under their control. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities allowed the ultra-right conservative media engrossed in distorting truth, spreading lies, making fabrications and breeding plots to lord it over by taking control of broadcasting. This is an unpardonable fascist arbitrary practice to trample down on justice, cover up the truth and stab at the people's mindset and conscience.
					
					 This is self-evident truth that the south Korean people can not remain a passive onlooker to the conservative group's moves to make the media, which is obliged to speak for the people and defend justice and truth, a paid trumpeter serving it.

articles.title: All Koreans Urged to Turn out in Struggle against S. Korean Authorities' War Moves
articles.content:
All Koreans Urged to Turn out in Struggle against S. Korean Authorities' War Moves

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- To fight out against the south Korean conservative authorities' reckless war moves aimed at invading the DPRK is the most pressing for defending peace of the country and destiny of the nation, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on to say:
					
					 The present south Korean ruling forces, obsessed with sycophancy toward the U.S. and confrontation with fellow countrymen, have intensified military confrontation with the DPRK, pursuant to the outsiders' hostile policy towards the DPRK, thus aggravating the situation of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Worse still, the south Korean puppet warmongers have massively concentrated aggression armed forces in five islands in the West Sea of Korea, which are short of a powder magazine, though the situation of the peninsula is on the point of war.
					
					 They staged large-scale anti-DPRK war exercises on those islands with the lapse of one year after the Yonphyong Island shelling incident as an occasion. 
					
					 There is no guarantee that the very recklessly bellicose remarks and provocative military maneuvers by the warmongers bereft of reason might not lead to a war against the DPRK. 
					
					 All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should turn out in a nationwide struggle against the south Korean belligerent forces' moves for war of aggression on the DPRK, transcending the differences of ideology and system.

articles.title: Roundup of Students in S. Korea
articles.content:
Roundup of Students in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police Saturday arrested students of the Federation of University Student Councils protesting against the flunkeyist and treacherous U.S.-south Korea FTA, according to the south Korean KBS.
					
					 That day the students staged demo outside Chongwadae, chanting slogans critical of the authorities keen on the conclusion of the humiliating FTA.
					
					 The police walked away all of them and are investigating them on charges of violation of the notorious "law on assembly and demonstration."

articles.title: S. Korean Judges Oppose Conclusion of FTA
articles.content:
S. Korean Judges Oppose Conclusion of FTA 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- More than 160 south Korean judges submitted a letter of proposals opposing the conclusion of the humiliating south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" to the president of the Supreme Court on Dec. 10. 
					
					 The conclusion of the FTA would seriously harm south Korea's judicial power, they said, adding:
					
					 The article dealing with "state litigation system for investors" among the contents of FTA is like a gun when viewed from the U.S. stand. South Korea will be forced to read the U.S. face and keep out of its way even though it does not pull the gun out of holster. 
					
					 They called for forming a body for reviewing the contents of the FTA.

articles.title: S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Shelling Exercises in West Sea
articles.content:
S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Shelling Exercises in West Sea
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The puppet marine corps of south Korea staged shelling exercises on Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea on Monday, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					
					 The puppet warlike forces, claiming "getting versed in prompt punishment posture in case of emergency", mobilized varieties of artillery pieces deployed on the islands and fired tens of thousands of shells at random into the surrounding waters for 2 hours.
					
					 The warmongers continue to stage firing drills in the West Sea of Korea where the north and the south stand in acute showdown.

articles.title: ITAR-TASS Introduces Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm Area in DPRK
articles.content:
ITAR-TASS Introduces Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm Area in DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- ITAR-TASS of Russia on Dec. 7 introduced the radically changed area of the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in the DPRK. 
					
					 The farm was built in a short span of time by the devoted efforts of officers and men of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, it reported.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il visited this farm area several times and showed deep care for provision of equipment to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Processing Factory, it said.
					
					 It introduced in detail Taedonggang Pig Farm, Taedonggang Terrapin Farm and Taedonggang Net-weaving Factory built in the area.

articles.title: DPRK's Peaceful Nuclear Activities Supported by France Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Peaceful Nuclear Activities Supported by France Organization

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association released a statement on Dec. 4 in support of the DPRK government's just stand on peaceful nuclear activities.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry on Nov. 30 stated that the use of nuclear energy for peaceful purposes is a legitimate right of all sovereign states and this is a promising way for easing the strain on electricity in the DPRK abundant on its raw materials.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association fully supports this stand of the DPRK on the peaceful use of nuclear energy and condemns the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 We will intensify the solidarity activities urging dialogue and negotiations for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Works Studied in 50 Odd Countries and Regions This Year
articles.content:
Works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Studied in 50 Odd Countries and Regions This Year

					Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, which clearly show the road ahead of the progressive mankind struggling for independence, have been studied and disseminated in 50 odd countries and regions this year.
					
					 They included Kim Il Sung's works "For the Complete Victory of Socialism" and "Let Us Uphold Independence" and Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-victorious Banner of Revolution".
					
					 Full texts or gists of the works were carried by media of different countries, among them Huan Qiu Shibao of China, ITAR-TASS of Russia, "F.M. 90.5" Radio of Cambodia, Democratic Congo's newspaper L'Avenir, Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud and Romanian newspaper Muncitoare of Romania.
					
					 Political parties, organizations and regional bodies carried in bulletins or posted on Internet homepages those works. They included the Brazilian Communist Party, the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea, the Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship, the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea and the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions.
					
					 Over 70 units published the works in pamphlet and e-book and had ceremonies of releasing them. Among the units were the Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy, the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People, the German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association, the Lao State Publishing House and the Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
					
					 Seminars, briefings and reading sessions on the works were held under the sponsorships of many political parties, organizations and institutions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday in 2012 to Be Marked Worldwide
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday in 2012 to Be Marked Worldwide

					Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- An International preparatory committee was formed in Sankt-Peterburg of Russia on Dec. 5 to celebrate the birthday (February 16) of General Secretary Kim Jong Il in 2012.
					
					 Attending its inaugural meeting were personages of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Sankt-Peterburg City Assembly and Juche idea study organizations.
					
					 Elena Bavichi, chairwoman of the Kim Jong Suk Women's Union of Russia, was elected chairperson of the international preparatory committee.
					
					  The committee decided to hold various political and cultural events, including symposium on Kim Jong Il's works, seminar on his exploits and lecture, on the occasion of his birthday.

articles.title: China Respects Russian People's Choice: Spokesman
articles.content:
China Respects Russian People's Choice: Spokesman 

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Foreign Ministry's spokesman expressed support for the results of Russia's State Duma election.
					
					 Speaking at a news conference on Friday, Hong Lei said some 700 members of international teams observed the election and generally appreciated the election results.
					
					 "The results reflect the desire of the Russian people," he said, adding, "China respects the choice of the Russian people and supports Russia's development in conformity with its actual conditions."

articles.title: China Observes Anniversary of People's Prosecution System
articles.content:
China Observes Anniversary of People's Prosecution System
						

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- China observed the 80th anniversary of the people's prosecution system on Friday. 
					
					 An art performance themed "For Impartiality and Justice" was given at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing.
					
					 It showed the historical course covered by people's prosecution organs under the leadership of the Communist Party, as well as achievements made by them in the new century.

articles.title: China Makes Efforts to Solve Drinking Water Problem
articles.content:
China Makes Efforts to Solve Drinking Water Problem
						

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region of China has put successful effort to solving the drinking water problem for the residents.
					
					 This year the region made it possible to supply clean water to a total of 340,000 residents.

articles.title: China Vows to Promote Building of Harmonious Oceans
articles.content:
China Vows to Promote Building of Harmonious Oceans
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- China's deputy permanent representative to the United Nations said the country would contribute to achieving peace of oceans and ensuring balance between their scientific protection and rational use.  
					
					 Speaking at a recent UN General Assembly meeting, Wang Min said China would take advantage of the 30th anniversary of the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) to make greater efforts together with other countries to build harmonious oceans.

articles.title: China to Intensify Supervision over Foodstuffs
articles.content:
China to Intensify Supervision over Foodstuffs
						

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- Recently, a national meeting on supervision over foodstuff security was held in Beijing.  
					
					 The meeting reviewed what has been gained in ensuring foodstuff security this year and discussed next year's tasks.
					
					 It decided to strictly crack down on illegal activities, improve the foodstuff security system and intensify supervision.

articles.title: Political Bureau of CPC Central Committee Meets
articles.content:
Political Bureau of CPC Central Committee Meets

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC) took place in Beijing on Friday.
					
					 It was stressed at the meeting that properly carrying on next year's economic activities was of weighty importance in ensuring a stable socio-economic development and creating favorable conditions for the upcoming 18th CPC Congress.
					
					 The meeting underscored the need to improve the people's living, keep prices stable and maintain the harmony and stability of society, thereby greeting the congress with signal achievements in the development of the economy and society.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Negotiated Solution to Iran's Nuclear Issue
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Negotiated Solution to Iran's Nuclear Issue 
						

					 Moscow, December 11 (KCNA) -- Vice Foreign Minister Sergei Lyavkov of Russia, in an interview with a TV on Dec. 9, expressed his country's stand to solve the Iranian nuclear issue through dialogue.
					
					 Iran has no military nuclear plan, he said, noting there is a confirmed data for it.
					
					 Sanctions are going ahead of dialogue in relation to the Iranian nuclear issue, he said, adding Russia stands against the fact that no progress in the nuclear negotiations with Iran should be a motive for promoting military action.
					
					 The Iranian nuclear issue should be solved through dialogue, he stated.

articles.title: Russia Rejects U.S. MD Proposal
articles.content:
Russia Rejects U.S. MD Proposal 
						

					 Moscow, December 11 (KCNA) -- Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Lyavkov rejected the U.S. proposal concerning the MD in an interview with a TV radio on Friday.
					
					 He noted Russia can not agree on the conditions raised by the U.S. as for the MD issue as they hurt Russia's interests.
					
					 Russia hopes for the agreement on this matter but such an agreement should be a realistic one, he said.

articles.title: Russia to Adopt Defense Industry Modernization Program
articles.content:
Russia to Adopt Defense Industry Modernization Program
						

					 Moscow, December 11 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin recently said the program for modernizing the country's defense industrial complex will be adopted shortly, a local media report said.  
					
					 The program is being worked out at the final stage and 3 trillion Rbl will be allotted for the program, Putin was quoted as saying.

articles.title: U.S. Drone Violation of Iran's Territorial Airspace Flayed
articles.content:
U.S. Drone Violation of Iran's Territorial Airspace Flayed
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Iranian permanent representative to the UN, in a letter to the UN on December 8, strongly denounced the U.S. drone violation of Iran's territorial airspace.
					
					 The letter noted that during recent months the U.S. has intensified provocative trick operations against Iran.
					
					 It called upon the UN to condemn the U.S. drone violation of Iran's territorial airspace and take clear and substantial steps to terminate the dangerous illegal acts against his country.

articles.title: U.S. Tries to Develop New Military Equipment
articles.content:
U.S. Tries to Develop New Military Equipment

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. persists in development of new military equipment in a scheme to realize its ambition for world supremacy.
					
					 As part of it, it lately conducted a test on new material, helpful to increasing the explosive power of shell, at a naval base in Virginia.

articles.title: U.S. Sanctions on Iran Slammed
articles.content:
U.S. Sanctions on Iran Slammed
						

					 Beijing, December 11 (KCNA) -- Hong Lei, spokesperson for the Foreign Ministry of China, in a recent press conference, clarified the stand of China against the U.S. sanctions on Iran.
					
					 Commenting on the U.S. demand on other countries to stop the oil dealings with Iran, Hong said that China is consistently opposed to the manner of applying unilateral sanctions against other countries by putting domestic law above international law.
					
					 China and Iran have made regular commercial dealings in the energy field, Hong said, adding this is not in breach of relevant UNSC resolution nor harm the interests of international community. Therefore, this can not be problematic, Hong held.

articles.title: Iran Criticizes U.S. for Launching Virtual Embassy
articles.content:
Iran Criticizes U.S. for Launching Virtual Embassy
						

					Tehran, December 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian officials criticized the United States for launching a virtual embassy for Iran.
					
					 Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast said in an interview with a news agency Thursday that the launch of the virtual embassy is an indication of the U.S. confession to the wrong decision to sever ties with Iran three decades ago, Iran's semi-official Mehr news agency reported Thursday.
					
					 Criticizing the U.S. sanction pressures on Iran over its nuclear program, the Iranian spokesman said it is better that the United States "takes lessens from the past and sincerely changes its approach" toward Iranians.

articles.title: Jordanian King Supports Palestinian People's Struggle
articles.content:
Jordanian King Supports Palestinian People's Struggle
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- King Abdullah II of Jordan, in a diplomatic meeting Thursday, reiterated support for the Palestinian National Authority and the Palestinians' rights for freedom and statehood.
					
					 The king underlined his country's support for the unity of the Palestinians and for all the efforts to realize the Palestinian reconciliation that will lead to united stances.
					
					 Meanwhile, the king said the continued Israeli settlement activities would undermine the peacemaking efforts.

articles.title: Myanmar President Calls for Promoting Essence of Traditional Medicine
articles.content:
Myanmar President Calls for Promoting Essence of Traditional Medicine 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Myanmar President U Thein Sein Thursday called on traditional medicine practitioners to preserve, protect and promote the essence of Myanmar traditional medicine.
					
					 U Thein Sein made the call in his message on the occasion of the 12th Myanmar Traditional Medicine Practitioners Conference underway in Nay Pyi Taw.
					
					 He urged the practitioners to have full trust and confidence in their long-accepted indigenous medicine, while having the awareness on the vital role of Myanmar medicine in public healthcare.
					
					Apart from rural folks, urban people are also accepting and relying more and more on the traditional medicine, he pointed out, believing that the development and advancement of the medicine at the service of Myanmar people is an encouraging sign and pride.

articles.title: Pakistani Lawmakers Suggest NATO Attack Appeared Deliberate
articles.content:
Pakistani Lawmakers Suggest NATO Attack Appeared Deliberate
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The NATO attack that killed two dozen Pakistani troops on the border with Afghanistan last month appeared to be deliberate, two Pakistani lawmakers said Friday.
					
					 The United States has insisted that the attack was not deliberate.
					
					 "We were told there are indications that this was a deliberate attack because nothing else makes sense," said member of Senate Sen. Tahir Mashhadi.
					
					 The NATO forces "knew very well these were Pakistani check posts," Mashhadi said, referring to the places where the troops were hit. "The check posts are clearly marked on all the maps."

articles.title: Two Palestinians Killed in Israeli Air Raid in Gaza
articles.content:
Two Palestinians Killed in Israeli Air Raid in Gaza

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is aggravating the regional situation while killing more Palestinians.
					
					 Two Palestinians were killed and six others wounded Thursday afternoon in Gaza in an Israeli air strike.
					
					 Such atrocities of the Israeli army are sparking off strong protest and denunciation of the international community.

articles.title: Malaysia's Industrial Output in Oct Grows 2.8 Pct Year-on-Year
articles.content:
Malaysia's Industrial Output in Oct Grows 2.8 Pct Year-on-Year
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Malaysia's industrial output in October grew 2.8 percent from last year led by gains in the manufacturing and electricity indices, the statistics department of this country said on Thursday.

articles.title: Economic Depression in Japan, New Zealand
articles.content:
Economic Depression in Japan, New Zealand
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Japan's core machinery orders fell a seasonally adjusted 6.9 percent in October from September for the second consecutive month of decline amid growing uncertainty over the course of the economy, the Cabinet Office said Thursday.
					
					 The September quarter manufacturing sales volume of New Zealand fell 1.4 percent, the government statistics agency announced Thursday.

articles.title: Cooperation among Asian Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Asian Countries

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Cambodia and the Philippines on Thursday signed an agreement to boost the bilateral cooperation on trade, investment, tourism and agriculture.
					
					 On the same day Cambodia and Vietnam made public a joint statement on boosting the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation to a new high-level.

articles.title: Japan's Trade Deficit
articles.content:
Japan's Trade Deficit
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The balance of Japan's trade in goods registered a deficit of 206.1 billion yen in October, the Ministry of Finance of this country said in a preliminary report on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Dar-Es-Salaam
articles.content:
Palhae, One of Kingdoms in Korean History 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Palhae (698-926), the successor to Koguryo, is well known in the Korean history for its strong military and developed economy and culture in the middle ages.
					
					 The kingdom was governed by emperor called Hwangsang or Chonson, which means a descendent of Heaven.
					
					Palhae, pursuing an invariable foreign policy, established relations with neighboring nations on its own initiative and defended its territorial integrity from invasions. 
					
					 The kingdom was capable of mobilizing 400,000 military personnel already in its early years and had hundreds of thousands of troops on a regular basis in the whole period of its existence. It retook most of the Koguryo territory by dint of military muscle. 
					
					 Rice, fermented soybean, plum, pear, silk, iron, copper and cotton cloth produced in the kingdom were in great demand at home and abroad.
					
					 For some two hundred years the kingdom was called a thriving nation in the East.
					
					 The excellent tradition and history of Palhae were carried forward by Koryo, the first unified state of the Korean nation.

articles.title: ACNC comenta adulacion a EE.UU. de Japon
articles.content:
Geographical Book Attached to True Records of King Sejong 
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The Geographical Book Attached to True Records of King Sejong is one of the Korean nation's precious cultural heritages, which is conducive to studying the history and geography of Korea before the second half of the 15th century.
					
					 The book began to be compiled from the end of the year 1424 and became a part of Sejong Silok (chronicles of King Sejong) in 1454.
					
					 The book is a revised and supplemented edition of the previously compiled Geographical Book on Eight Provinces.
					
					The book divides the country into 8 provinces and gives their geographical details.
					
					 The details include administrative changes of counties and sub-counties, their history, numbers of their households, military deployments and names of provincial seats.
					
					 It is made up of more than 60 particulars geographically dealing with politics, economy, military, culture and nature.

articles.title: ACNC urge solucion pacifica del problema nuclear de Iran
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves Dar-Es-Salaam
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, left Dar-Es-Salaam on Sunday after wrapping up his official goodwill visit to Tanzania.
					
					 He was accompanied by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun and other suite members. 
					
					 Kim and his party were seen off by Minister of Constitution and Justice of Tanzania Celina Kombani and DPRK Ambassador to Tanzania Jo Yong Man.

articles.title: Abonos organicos de gran eficiencia economica
articles.content:
S. Korean Marine Corps Stages Shelling Exercises in West Sea
						

					 Pyongyang, December 12 (KCNA) -- The puppet marine corps of south Korea staged shelling exercises on Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island in the West Sea of Korea on Monday, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					
					 The puppet warlike forces, claiming "getting versed in prompt punishment posture in case of emergency", mobilized varieties of artillery pieces deployed on the islands and fired tens of thousands of shells at random into the surrounding waters for 2 hours.
					
					 The warmongers continue to stage firing drills in the West Sea of Korea where the north and the south stand in acute showdown.
